title: TidyTuesday
text:
TidyTuesday is a weekly community project that creates a space for data enthusiasts to share and learn.
The focus is using R and the tidyverse package to clean, wrangle, and visualize data. Each week a new dataset is released and participants are encouraged to explore and visualize the data in creative ways.
I try to participate in TidyTuesday as often as I can - as it’s a great way to grow my skills and learn from others.
This page is a collection of my favortie TidyTuesday contributions.

title: Python Libraries
text:
difPy is a Python library that can be used to find duplicate images, or similar images based on their tensors (image content). You can also use this to sort out duplicate images based on resolution and manage your images in a programmatic way.
import difPy
from multiprocessing import freeze_support

image_directory = 'path/to/images'

if __name__ == '__main__':
    freeze_support()
    dif = difPy.build(image_directory)
    search = difPy.search(dif)
    print(search.result)

title: Gallery
text: This page showcases visualizations I’ve crafted over the years. Some of these visuals are part of broader analysis projects or demonstrations of specific techniques.

title: Bradford Johnson
text:
Hey there, I’m Ford, a data analyst and storyteller with experience navigating the intersection of web analytics and big data. I’m skilled at untangling complex datasets to find useful insights and telling engaging stories with the data.
Beyond the digital realm, you’ll often find me exploring the great outdoors, capturing moments through the lens of my camera, or embarking on hiking adventures.
Feel free to explore my work on this site, where I share insights, projects, and a glimpse into my data journey.

title: Python Libraries
text:
PyYAML
PyYAML can be used to process and parse YAML files with Python.
import yaml

with open("file.yml", 'r') as stream:
    try:
        config = yaml.safe_load(stream)
        print(config)
    except yaml.YAMLError as exc:
        print(exc)
